headline: Asian stocks hit by fresh tech fears as gold retreats from peak
summary: Asian stocks sank Friday amid fresh worries over vast investments in artificial intelligence, gold and silver tumbled after hitting multiple record highs and oil retreated on hopes for an easing of US-Iran tensions.Gold was also in retreat, sitting around $5,200 an ounce, a day after topping out above $5,595.

headline: Asian shares are mostly lower after a wild day on Wall St ends with modest moves

headline: US futures and Asian shares slip after a wild day on Wall St ends with a whimper
summary: Oil prices dropped and the prices of gold and silver weakened.  The CEO of Indonesia's stock market, Imam Rachman, resigned Friday “As part of a commitment toward recent market conditions,” the exchange said in an announcement.  Tokyo's Nikkei 225 edged 0.2% higher to 53,471.73 as stocks related to artificial intelligence declined.

content.title: US futures and Asian shares slip after a wild day on Wall St ends with a whimper

The CEO of Indonesia's stock market, Imam Rachman, resigned Friday “As part of a commitment toward recent market conditions,” the exchange said in an announcement.  Tokyo's Nikkei 225 edged 0.2% higher to 53,471.73 as stocks related to artificial intelligence declined.

headline: US futures fall and world shares are mixed as markets await Trump's word on replacing Fed chief
summary: U.S. futures dropped while European shares opened higher on Friday after markets retreated in Asia ahead of a possible announcement by U.S. President Donald Trump on his nominee to replace Jerome Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve.  Oil prices dropped and the prices of gold and silver weakened.  Trump chose Powell to led the U.S. central bank in 2017 but has relentlessly assailed him for not cutting interest rates quickly as quickly as the president would like.

content.title: US futures fall and world shares are mixed as markets await Trump's word on replacing Fed chief
content.summary: U.S. futures dropped while European shares opened higher on Friday after markets retreated in Asia ahead of a possible announcement by U.S. President Donald Trump on his nominee to replace Jerome Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve.  Oil prices dropped and the prices of gold and silver weakened.  Trump chose Powell to led the U.S. central bank in 2017 but has relentlessly assailed him for not cutting interest rates quickly as quickly as the president would like.

headline: Bitcoin Falls as Microsoft Leads Tech Selloff After Earnings
summary: Bitcoin remained under pressure after hitting a two-month low overnight as disappointing earnings from Microsoft fueled a wider selloff in tech stocks. "We are not in the AI bubble camp, but we do believe that the market will question the return on capital expenditure from the tech companies," Jefferies economist Mohit Kumar said in a note.

content.title: Bitcoin Falls as Microsoft Leads Tech Selloff After Earnings
content.summary: Bitcoin remained under pressure after hitting a two-month low overnight as disappointing earnings from Microsoft fueled a wider selloff in tech stocks. "We are not in the AI bubble camp, but we do believe that the market will question the return on capital expenditure from the tech companies," Jefferies economist Mohit Kumar said in a note.

headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Gold Swings
summary: Gold prices went haywire. A 9.4 percentage point swing in gold futures prices between the intraday high and low was the largest range since April 2013, according to Dow Jones Market Data. Futures settled slightly up on the day, at a new record high.

content.title: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Gold Swings
content.summary: Gold prices went haywire. A 9.4 percentage point swing in gold futures prices between the intraday high and low was the largest range since April 2013, according to Dow Jones Market Data. Futures settled slightly up on the day, at a new record high.

headline: Cloud AI Today - AI Growth Fueled By Cloud Innovation and Demand
summary: The Cloud AI market, specifically within the domain of Artificial Intelligence as a Service (AIaaS), is experiencing robust expansion driven by advancements in cloud infrastructure and the demand for scalable, cost-effective solutions. headline: Bitcoin, XRP, Ethereum Dive. Why Cryptos Are Getting Bashed Again.
summary: The Bitcoin price was falling amid a recent selloff in Big Tech stocks and expectations that Kevin Warsh will be appointed the next chair of the Federal Reserve, which is dragging down cryptocurrencies.  Robinhood  a cryptocurrency exchange, fell by 0.3% and  Coinbase  fell by 2.7%.  At the same time, there are mounting expectations that Kevin Warsh will be nominated to replace Jerome Powell as head of the U.S. central bank.

Robinhood  a cryptocurrency exchange, fell by 0.3% and  Coinbase  fell by 2.7%.  At the same time, there are mounting expectations that Kevin Warsh will be nominated to replace Jerome Powell as head of the U.S. central bank.

headline: US futures, precious metals fall after Trump says he is nominating Kevin Warsh to be next Fed Chair
summary: Futures fell on Wall Street Friday as word leaked that President Donald Trump would nominate former Federal Reserve official Kevin Warsh to be the next chair of the U.S. central bank.  Futures for the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average were each 0.5% lower before the opening bell.  Nasdaq futures were down 0.6%.
